meanings.definition: The ability of a vehicle to withstand a crash and protect its occupants.
meanings.sent1: The crashworthinesses of the car saved the passengers from harm.
meanings.sent2: When buying a car, it's important to consider the crashworthinesses of different models.
meanings.sent3: The crashworthinesses of the old car were put to the test in a bumper car ride.
meanings.sent4: Her determination had the crashworthinesses of a sturdy vehicle, unyielding to obstacles.
meanings.sent5: The crashworthinesses of the castle walls held strong against the enemy's attack.

meanings.definition: The quality of being able to resist damage in the event of a collision.
meanings.sent1: The crashworthinesses of the helmet protected the cyclist during the accident.
meanings.sent2: Manufacturers focus on improving the crashworthinesses of their products to ensure safety.
meanings.sent3: The crashworthinesses of the cake surprised everyone when it remained intact after falling.
meanings.sent4: His arguments had the crashworthinesses of a reinforced steel beam, impervious to criticism.
meanings.sent5: The crashworthinesses of the umbrella shielded her from the sudden downpour.
